channel.title: they better show at new hitman game at the e thing

item.title: they better show at new hitman game at the e thing
item.dc:creator: Charchar
item.description:
Nope, the old “Tenchu” is the jap version of hitman, and it was a great game, way more entertaining than the lonely bald

item.title: they better show at new hitman game at the e thing
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
Yeah, if Japanese Game designers ever touched Hitman, it would become
“Yuffie Kisaragi: The Game” (Note: Yuffie Kisaragi was the Materia thief/ Part-time Ninja in Final Fantasy VII who would become a part of the Travelling party if given the right choice and Random encounter.)

Read full topic
item.source: they better show at new hitman game at the e thing

item.title: they better show at new hitman game at the e thing
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
CTID:

I never saw the first movie, but if past experience from Game-To-Movie shows me anything… (Doom/Max Payne) I’m glad I didn’t.

EDIT: Apparently Square Enix is making Hitman 5, instead of IO Interactive. =/

Square Enix bought Eidos, so don’t worry that Hitman won’t probably get touched by Japanese game designers.

It would own if Rocksteady made a Hitman game tho, but they’re busy with Arkham Asylum 2 and that’s a good thing.

Read full topic

item.title: they better show at new hitman game at the e thing
item.dc:creator: Apollomasque
item.description:
bigfan421:

Hitman’s Pretty awesome, eh assassinates persons and doesn’t afraid of Mardi Gras

Anyhow, I’d be pretty psyched to see an announcement for a new Hitman Game.
Never Completed Blood Money but it was pretty cool

Doesn’t afraid of Mardi Gras indeed!
I never played the hitman game, but I have seen the movie.
I’m guessing it’s not an accurate representation.
